title: Action
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only Enums </> ReplionClient.Action: Action

title: Data
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> ReplionClient.Data: any? The Player Data. Doesn't exist until you call Start the Replion.

title: Get
content: </> ReplionClient:Get(path:: {string} | string) → any Returns the value at the given path.

title: GetData
content: This is a yielding function. When called, it will pause the Lua thread that called the function until a result is ready to be returned, without interrupting other scripts. Yields </> ReplionClient:GetData() → any Returns the Data table, will yield if the Data does not exist.

title: OnUpdate
content: </> ReplionClient:OnUpdate(path:: {string} | string) → ( callback(...any) → (), Connection )

title: Errors
content: Type	DescriptionInvalid callback	Occur when the callback isn't a function.

title: Start
content: </> ReplionClient:Start() → () Starts the Replion, will request the Player Data from the server. Until this function is called, the Replion will not have any data.

title: Action
content: Enum </> interface Action { Added: "Added"-- A new value was added; Changed: "Changed"-- A value was changed; Removed: "Removed"-- A value was removed. }

content: Enum </> interface Action { Added: "Added"-- A new value was added; Changed: "Changed"-- A value was changed; Removed: "Removed"-- A value was removed. }

title: Configuration
content: </> interface Configuration { Player: Player Data: any WriteLib: {[string]: ( Replion, ...any ) → (...any)} }

title: new
content: </> ReplionServer.new(configuration: Configuration) → ReplionServer Creates a new Replion to the desired player.

title: Errors
content: Type	DescriptionInvalid player	Occur when the player argument isn't a Player instance. Invalid data	Occur when the data argument isn't a table.

title: OnUpdate
content: </> ReplionServer:OnUpdate( path: string | {string}, callback: (...any) → () ) → Connection Listen to the changes of a value on the Data table.
